evidence.name: Neighbor's Testimony
evidence.description: A neighbor reported hearing a loud crash from the Vance property. They couldn't recall the exact time, only that it was 'just as the streetlights flickered back on.'
evidence.timeHappenedDescription: A noise was heard right as the 90-minute power outage was ending.

evidence.name: Physician's Visit Log
evidence.description: Dr. Finch's digital calendar shows a house call to the Vance residence for a routine check-up earlier in the day.
evidence.timeHappenedDescription: Dr. Finch's visit establishes he was present, but well before the murder.

evidence.name: Last Email Sent
evidence.description: The last outgoing email from Arthur Vance's computer was sent to his lawyer at 9:30 PM, discussing changes to his will.
evidence.timeHappenedDescription: This was Arthur Vance's last known action before the events of the night began.

evidence.name: When did Arthur Vance die?
evidence.description: The coroner's preliminary report cannot pinpoint the exact time of death due to the sedative's effects, but places it sometime shortly after the struggle.
evidence.timeHappenedDescription: The moment the victim succumbed to the poison.

evidence.name: Text from Business Partner
evidence.description: A text message from Marcus Thorne to an unknown contact, sent at 11:45 PM: 'It's done. The old man won't be a problem anymore. The contingency is in place.'
evidence.timeHappenedDescription: This message was sent after all events at the house concluded.

evidence.name: Body Discovered
evidence.description: The next morning, police arrive at the scene in response to the neighbor's delayed call and discover the body of Arthur Vance in his study.
evidence.timeDiscoveredDescription: The investigation begins with the discovery of the body the next morning.

evidence.name: Security Log: Front Door 9:55PM
evidence.description: The smart home's security log shows the front door was accessed with a keycard at 9:55 PM. The log does not indicate if it was an entry or exit.
evidence.timeHappenedDescription: This was the last recorded use of the front door before the power outage.

evidence.name: Security Log: Front Door 11:31PM
evidence.description: The security log for the front door shows it was opened at 11:31 PM.  No indication of it being an entry or exit.
evidence.timeHappenedDescription: This door was used moments after the neighbor heard a crash.

evidence.name: Voicemail from Assistant
evidence.description: A frantic voicemail from Evelyn Reed on the victim's phone, left at 9:40 PM. 'Arthur, I'm just seeing your email now. I'm on my way over, I should be there in about 15 minutes.'
evidence.timeHappenedDescription: Evelyn was on her way to the house just before the power went out.

evidence.name: Assistant Leaving
evidence.description: Evelyn Reed stated she arrived to find Arthur agitated about his will. They had a brief, tense conversation before the power went out. She says she left immediately in the dark, not seeing anyone else.
evidence.timeHappenedDescription: Evelyn claims she left right as the power outage began.

evidence.name: City-Wide Power Outage
evidence.description: At 10:00 PM, a scheduled power outage affected the entire district for approximately 60 minutes. The victim's mansion backup generator was activated, but only powered essential systems.
evidence.timeHappenedDescription: The power outage marks the beginning of the critical events.

evidence.name: Broken Wine Glass
evidence.description: Shards of a wine glass found in the study. Forensic analysis found traces of a potent sedative. The mess suggests it was knocked over during a period of low visibility, likely during the power outage.
evidence.timeHappenedDescription: The sedative was administered sometime during the power outage.

evidence.name: Overturned Bookshelf
evidence.description: A large bookshelf in the study was toppled over, indicating a violent struggle that happened after the victim was likely incapacitated by the sedative from the wine.
evidence.timeHappenedDescription: The struggle occurred after the victim was drugged.

gameSettings.objective: Arthur Vance, a reclusive tech millionaire, has been found dead in his study. Suspects include his ambitious business partner, Marcus Thorne; his loyal but frantic assistant, Evelyn Reed; and his personal physician, Dr. Finch. The cause of death is poisoning, but signs of a struggle suggest it wasn't that simple.
gameSettings.questionText: Reconstruct the timeline of events from the night of the murder. Drag and drop the evidence into the correct chronological order to reveal what truly happened.
gameSettings.invalidConnection: These pieces of evidence don't reveal any meaningful connection.
